definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs

sentences.english: There are beautiful prose poetry offered in our Prose and Poetry section.
sentences.chinese: 在“散文诗”这个栏目里有许多美妙的散文诗提供。

sentences.english: There are beautiful prose poetry offered in our Prose and Poetry section.
sentences.chinese: 在“散文诗”这个栏目里有许多美妙的散文诗提供。

sentences.english: The Prophet is a poetry collection written by Gibran, a forerunner of Arabic contemporary literature.
sentences.chinese: 《先知》是阿拉伯现代文学先驱纪伯伦的一部散文诗。

sentences.english: It is a beautifully written prose-poem.
sentences.chinese: 它写得像散文诗一样优美。

sentences.english: The spiritual core of Lu Xun's prose poem Kite is repenting consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 鲁迅的散文诗《风筝》的精神内核是忏悔意识。

sentences.english: Prose Poetry walks from world's life into an art state full of love and aestheticism.
sentences.chinese: 散文诗，从人间烟火中走进唯爱唯美的艺术境界。

definition: a pre-Tang Dynasty genre of poetry, relatively free in form, usually having four, five, six or seven characters per line
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
